page.title: 03TRANSPORT
page.content: {West Bridgford}is separated from Nottingham by the{River Trent.}The river is wide and deep here, so from very early times there has been a bridge across it, called{Trent Bridge. The present{Trent Bridge}has three arches and carries six lanes of traffic across the river. Further upstream is another big road bridge called{Clifton Bridge. This takes traffic on a by-pass road round Nottingham. Two{railway bridges}have been built across the river but now the railways do not use them. One of them has been converted into a road bridge. An old{toll bridge}crossed the river at{Wilford.}It has been altered recently and now is just a pedestrian bridge. The{suspension bridge}is another foot bridge near to Trnet Bridge.
